➡️ Black Women: 61 cents
➡️ Native American Women: 58 cents
➡️ Latina Women: 53 cents

It's 2019, we need to fix this. Proud to support the Paycheck Fairness Act.

Proud to announce the hiring of Heather Hutt, Deanne Millison, and Meaghan Lynch to senior positions on my staff – all women of color. Each of them are experienced public servants & I am confident they will serve the people of California well.

Proud to support the more than 10,000 University of California Research and Technical workers striking for higher wages & those joining them in solidarity today. These workers are at the heart of our state's research institutions and their work deserves to be valued.

Here’s one phrase Secretary Nielsen didn’t mention yesterday when talking about threats to our homeland: climate change. We know climate change poses an existential threat to our planet. Ignoring this won't make it go away. We must confront it head on with bold action.

Something we've got to keep in mind: a Green New Deal has to be built upon equity & justice. We have an opportunity right now to address climate change while also lifting up communities of color, the poor, and those who have been too often left behind. Let's get it done.

The Trump Administration is proposing cutting more than a trillion dollars from Medicare & Medicaid in part to pay for extending the massive tax cuts to the top 1% that Republicans passed in 2017. 

This is a disgrace.

Housing is a human right. Families must be able to raise their children in a safe environment without the risk of being poisoned. $8.6 billion for an unnecessary border wall would be a grave misuse of American taxpayers' money. I have opposed every bill that would fund the president's vanity project & fully intend to vote NO on any budget proposal that includes border wall funding.

There is strong support for universal background checks for gun purchases & we have a bill in the Senate right now to make it happen. It’s time for Congress to have the courage to act. My colleagues & I have called on the Senate Judiciary Committee to hold a hearing on our bill.

Reminder that the GOP tax law of 2017 is overwhelmingly benefiting the top 1% at the expense of middle class & working families. It's time we took action to ensure that Venezuelans in the U.S. are not sent back to a country in crisis under Maduro. This week I reiterated my call for the administration to grant Temporary Protected Status to Venezuela. It's just the right thing to do.

When we lift up women, we lift up families, we lift up communities, we lift up economies & we lift up entire countries. Women have made incredible achievements this past year but let's recognize this  #InternationalWomensDay that the fight for fairness & equality continues.

I was extremely troubled by reports last year of inadequate housing conditions at Camp Pendleton. There's just no excuse for treating our service members & their families this way. That's why @SenFeinstein & I just introduced a bill to increase oversight of military housing.

Everyone should pay attention to what is happening to our courts because this will impact us for generations to come. This Administration is committed to transforming our courts with extreme nominees who will bring bias to the bench. I’ll do everything I can to stop them.

These efforts to push controversial & ideological nominees will continue. Kenneth Lee was recently nominated to the Ninth Circuit & has repeatedly lacked transparency about his record of controversial writings, including one where he defended racist jokes at Cornell University.

Eric Murphy was also confirmed for a lifetime appointment to the Sixth Circuit. As Ohio’s Solicitor General, Murphy filed a brief in opposition to marriage equality for LGBTQ Americans in the landmark 2015 case Obergefell v. Hodges.

Chad Readler was confirmed for a lifetime appointment to the Sixth Circuit. As Acting Assistant AG, Readler filed a brief for the Trump administration that refused to defend the ACA, a position that would eliminate protections for millions of Americans w/ pre-existing conditions.

A quick thread on what Republicans & this administration are doing to reshape our courts. 

Just this week the Senate confirmed numerous controversial & ideological nominees who have expressed views contrary to our foundational values of justice & equality.

Students should be able to go to college without going deep into a financial hole, and it's time we took action to make college debt-free. Proud to join my colleagues yesterday to introduce a bill that would help students go to college without going into debt.

Our criminal justice system is broken. From a money bail system that disproportionately harms the poor & people of color, to the reality that Black & brown Americans are incarcerated at higher rates. We must recognize these injustices & fight for a fairer system. #DayofEmpathy

Today the Senate voted to advance the nomination of Chad Readler to the Sixth Circuit. Readler defended some of the Trump administration's most abhorrent policies & is missing the support of a home-state senator. I voted NO & urge all of my colleagues to reject his nomination.
